name: Niagara Lodge & Suites

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here as we just needed a cheap night away from the kids. Don't expect to much but for the money you can't beat it. Indoor pool and a good breakfast. I doubt I would stay here for a week or anything but a weekend away on a budget, this place does work.
reviews.title: Just needed a bed

reviews.text: We got a family suite for 3 nights for $225. Clearly the price was the main reason we went there but again you get what you paid for. One room was laminated and was good but the other one was carpeted and was disgusting. I was afraid of stepping in there. The whole place is really dirty.. surprisingly the breakfast is OK. you wonder how they make any money. However again every is the bare minimum. We ended up checking out one night earlier as I was afraid for my baby to catch some disease from that carpet which probably has not seen vacuum since the time hotel was built.. If you can't afford a little bit more then I guess nothing you can do. However I bet by doing a little bit of research on available deals you could get better for same money. Kids enjoyed the pool but at end my daughter was having itchy eyes, I suspect from the pools ‘water with too much chlorine as it does not seem to get changed. Staffs are very friendly though. First and last stay there.
reviews.title: You get what you paid for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couple with young kids from Toronto
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got into Niagara Falls late and thought this might be a good bargain. It wasn't. The room door didn't fit properly in the frame and cold air blew in all night. The room heater didn't have a thermostat so it would get too hot in the room and then you would have to wake up to shut it off. Then the cold air would come back in and an hour later you would have to get up and turn on the heater. The shower also ran hot and cold. For $40 I didn't even complain to the staff. The breakfast wasn't too bad though. If the renos in the lobby had been done in the rooms, it would be spectacular.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

reviews.text: The price is right if you are not looking for anything special other than a place to lay your head. The walls are very thin and you hear your neigbours talking, using the microwave, shower etc. The rooms have stains on the floor, walls, bed sheets. Don't drop anything in the bathroom or if you do throw it out immediately! The toilet seat was not attached properly, the lights didn't work. If you want cheap, stay here, if you want luxury find another hotel!
reviews.title: run down motel.

reviews.text: im 16 and my friend and i decided to spend the night here. we arrived around four pm and walked to our room. when we got there the door would not open and we had to call the maid to help us. things were clean, however there was a stain on the carpet. the headboards to the beds arent even attached to the beds themselves but instead, glued to the walls. the lights were extremely dim and we had to call the girl at the front desk to come fix one of our lamps. the king bed was nice, the bedding was clean. the fridge and microwave were also clean. the bathroom had no toilet paper holder and the toilet didnt flush well. the staff was extremely rude, i went to ask for another roll of toilet paper and they gave me dirty looks. the indoor pool looks gross and we never swam in it. on checkout, my friend and i slept in until 12 so we didnt get out till about 1, and the guy at the front desk yelled at us for that. i would not return to this motel ever.
reviews.title: rude staff.

reviews.text: My family of 5 stayed here for 2 nights just after Christmas, and believe me this was the hotel from hell....we wanted to get a refund but the clerk at the hotel said they couldn't since it was already charged and paid for....so we checked out the first set of rooms and boy oh boy where they horrible so we asked to change them, so he let us have 2 other rooms and not much better. The one room DID NOT HAVE HEAT AND we had to buy a heated blanket for out kids, thank god there was a door between the 2 suites so we kept it open for heat to go in this room. Only 1 microwave in one room and in the other no fridge. Both rooms dirty carpet and absolutelly dirty walls. We didnt stay hardly at all in these rooms,only too sleep. We even bought new sheets & pillows because the ones that were provided seem old and worn and dirty.
reviews.title: Completelly Unacceptable...

reviews.text: WE went to the front desk several times to complain and called the front desk but nobody was there.....so before you ever book this place for the love of yourself and family DON'T
reviews.title: Overdue for Renovations & washroom upgrades!

reviews.text: We booked a Queen room with 2 queen beds, carpet was extremely dirty as well as the washroom tub. In the morning, I made a request for the tub to be cleaned, they came and sprayed the tub but did not wash it out, however they left clean towels. I ended up having to buy disinfectant to clean it myself. We wanted to check out, but our whole stay was already billed to our credit card prior to arrival. Our room rate included breakfast, can't comment as we did not take advantage of it. After complaining, the guy at the front desk was generous enough to give us a deal on a 1 bedroom suite which is a better choice for families. Again I had to clean the tub, however it wasn't as dirty as the previous room.
reviews.title: You definately get what you pay for

reviews.text: Prime location on Lundy's Lane, lots of amenities around. We went to several restaurants, but Magnolia next door topped it off, it was the best chinese food ever!
reviews.title: AWFUL!!!

reviews.text: We rented a room with 2 queens. It was outdates and dingy. There was a used wash cloth in our room. We noticed something on our bed, it was a quarter. When we pull the bed apart there was change in it. What, is this a mint/chocolate replacement? Weird. The owners spoke broken English and I had a man from another room come over and ask to use our bathroom.... so sketchy.
reviews.title: Not great but close to the action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DO NOT STAY HERE!! We checked out within 1 hour of being there!! Massive gap between the door and the frame which caused a loud rattle with the wind!! Bugs in the shower, dirty sheets, smelly, cold. Could not bear the thought of staying in the room so we checked out before we even thought about it. Whatever you do, don't even think about booking this place!! Disgusting!
reviews.title: Absolutely horrible!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is terrible. When we arrived the phone did not work and we had the impression that they don't do the correct cleaning to the sheets. I don't recommend this place. We stayed in another hotel in Toronto and the quality was excellent. We believe that these people don't care about having a nice place only to take profits, that's all. Is an experience no to go with lower prices and obtain bad quality
reviews.title: Went for holidays

reviews.text: The breakfast was more than expected with hot waffles, sausages, scrambled eggs, potato wedges and assortment of cold items. Room had microwave and fridge. The lobby and breakfast area have been renovated and look great. We had a family suite and it was awful. One of the lamps had no switch so you had to unscrew the bulb to turn it off. Rooms were very dim. Heating was either on or off, no automatic shut-off to control temperature, and there was only one heater for both rooms. Stain down side of box spring. One cupboard door hanging by a hinge in the kitchenette. Ants were crawling all over the kitchenette counter. One outlet had a prong protruding where it had broken off the plug. The bathtub was dirty. No face cloths or hand towels provided. No plug for the kitchenette sink and no dishes, cutlery or dish soap to clean up with. We booked for three nights - we stayed one. They are in the slow process of renovating the entire building.
reviews.title: Rooms don't live up to the Internet pictures.

reviews.text: Room - it is ok, just do not mind the decor. The sink is leaking. The door lock does not seem to be very secured, no chain. Hotel - the outside and its surrounding needs a facelift. Breakfast - better than any other hotels would offer. Rate - would be better if booked at the same day. I just checked now and the rate is much cheaper for the same suite we are staying for tonight than what I already paid. Overall - very good for a very short stay.
reviews.title: Not bad but also not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel,is in need of tender loving,care but the,price,on the weekend was,god value. It has a pool,and hot tub but neither was in great condition. The pool's cleanliness was questionable and the hot tub was boiling - dangerous. Breakfast was plentiful and again for the price it was adequate. More staff would have been helpful.
reviews.title: Basic Hotel Reasonable for Niagara Falls on the Weekend

reviews.text: This hotel is nothing like the photos. First of all, I reserved a suite with two bedrooms. The first room I was taken to was on the 2nd floor and we had someone in a wheelchair. The air conditioning also did not work. We requested another room and finally received an two bedroom family suite. The air in this room did not work either. I was also promised a refrigerator and microwave which had to be moved from other rooms. The outdoor pool was under construction and the indoor pool smelled strongly of chlorine. The hottub also did not work and when I complained I got no where with the manager. The breakfast is okay and the rooms do have a smell to them. This place was packed on the weekend and parking is limited.
reviews.title: Average Hotel for Good Price in Niagara Falls

reviews.text: Once I opened the room door my family and I wanted a refund. The room had a strong and awful smell, the tub was disgusting and a spider was in it. The sofa bed when opened was filled with bread crumbs.. Two tiny towels big enough to dry your face with..everything had a smell to it.. All four of us was just itching and scratching. 5 minutes after called the front desk to ask for a refund and it wasn't possible the only thing they offered was a different room.. BAD just BAD
reviews.title: Would never stay there again.

reviews.text: With all the choices available in Niagara Falls this hotel is affordable, conveniently located and has friendly staff. The indoor pool was a nice bonus along with the enclosed parking for motorcycles. I would stay there again and recommend it to other travelers.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good for a 2 star person! There are two pools but the indoor pool is dirty with hair, lent, and boogers! and the outdoor pool has no water in it! the sheets are covered with burn from cigarettes
reviews.title: Bugs in bed!!

description: Niagara Falls hotel is located at Lundy's Lane Tourist District nearby Canada One Outlet Mall which features shopping. Niagara Lodge & Suites is just at short drive from the Niagara Falls Golf Club, Wines Route and Falls view Casino. The hotel is 2 miles from Skylon Tower, which features views of Niagara Falls.Niagara Lodge & Suites features finest guestrooms and suites with Color Cable TV, refrigerators, coffeemakers, private washrooms. Guests will also enjoy the free continental breakfast as well as free wireless high-speed internet access during their economical stay.Book Spacious Inter-connected rooms and Renovated Family Rooms with kitchenette for the comfortable get together of family. Jacuzzi suites featured with heart shaped tubs are available for romantic couples.Niagara Falls hotel provides an indoor heated pool and splashing outdoor pool with sundeck, a massive whirlpool for the relaxation of the guests. Lobby area offers a relaxing sitting room with paid access on our guest computer. Snacks and drinks from our bank of vending machines also located in our main lobby areaFree Parking for Cars & Motor Coaches is available on site. Guest can also enjoy Barbeque facilities to make their stay memorable.Shuttle stops right in front of the hotel to make your stay affordable.The hospitable staff at Niagara Lodge & Suites prides themselves in making your stay a most pleasurable one and experiencing comfort as being in your own home.
